sections.heading: Overview
sections.content:
This page contains code examples that show how to connect your Python application
to MongoDB with various settings.

sections.heading: Tip
sections.content:
To learn more about the connection options on this page, see the link
provided in each section.
To use a connection example from this page, copy the code example into the sample application or your own application.
Be sure to replace all placeholders in the code examples, such as <hostname> , with
the relevant values for your MongoDB deployment.

subsections.heading: Sample Application
subsections.content:
You can use the following sample application to test the code examples on this
page. To use the sample application, perform the following steps:
- Ensure you have PyMongo installed.
- Copy the following code and paste it into a new .py file.
- Copy a code example from this page and paste it on the specified lines in the file.
Ensure you have PyMongo installed.
Copy the following code and paste it into a new .py file.
Copy a code example from this page and paste it on the specified lines in the file.
Select the Synchronous or Asynchronous tab to see the
corresponding code:
code_blocks: 1 import pymongo 2 from pymongo import MongoClient 3 4 try : 5 uri = "<connection string URI>" 6 client = MongoClient(uri) 7 8 database = client[ "<database name>" ] 9 collection = database[ "<collection name>" ] 10 11 # start example code here 12 13 # end example code here 14 15 client.close() 16 17 except Exception as e: 18 raise Exception( 19 "The following error occurred: " , e)

1 import asyncio 2 import pymongo 3 from pymongo import AsyncMongoClient 4 5 async def main () : 6 try : 7 uri = "<connection string URI>" 8 client = AsyncMongoClient(uri) 9 10 database = client[ "<database name>" ] 11 collection = database[ "<collection name>" ] 12 13 # start example code here 14 15 # end example code here 16 17 await client.close() 18 19 except Exception as e: 20 raise Exception( 21 "The following error occurred: " , e) 22 23 asyncio.run(main())

sections.heading: Insert One
sections.content: To learn more about the insert_one() method, see the Insert Documents guide.
code_blocks: result = collection.insert_one({ "<field name>" : "<value>" }) print (result.acknowledged)
result = await collection.insert_one({ "<field name>" : "<value>" }) print (result.acknowledged)

sections.heading: Insert Multiple
sections.content: To learn more about the insert_many() method, see the Insert Documents guide.
code_blocks: document_list = [ { "<field name>" : "<value>" }, { "<field name>" : "<value>" } ] result = collection.insert_many(document_list) print (result.acknowledged)
document_list = [ { "<field name>" : "<value>" }, { "<field name>" : "<value>" } ] result = await collection.insert_many(document_list) print (result.acknowledged)

sections.heading: Update One
sections.content: To learn more about the update_one() method, see the Update Documents guide.
code_blocks: query_filter = { "<field to match>" : "<value to match>" } update_operation = { "$set" : { "<field name>" : "<value>" } } result = collection.update_one(query_filter, update_operation) print (result.modified_count)

query_filter = { "<field to match>" : "<value to match>" } update_operation = { "$set" : { "<field name>" : "<value>" } } result = await collection.update_one(query_filter, update_operation) print (result.modified_count)

sections.heading: Update Multiple
sections.content: To learn more about the update_many() method, see the Update Documents guide.
code_blocks: query_filter = { "<field to match>" : "<value to match>" } update_operation = { "$set" : { "<field name>" : "<value>" } } result = collection.update_many(query_filter, update_operation) print (result.modified_count)

query_filter = { "<field to match>" : "<value to match>" } update_operation = { "$set" : { "<field name>" : "<value>" } } result = await collection.update_many(query_filter, update_operation) print (result.modified_count)

sections.heading: Replace One
sections.content: To learn more about the replace_one() method, see the Replace Documents guide.
code_blocks: query_filter = { "<field to match>" : "<value to match>" } replace_document = { "<new document field name>" : "<new document value>" } result = collection.replace_one(query_filter, replace_document) print (result.modified_count)

query_filter = { "<field to match>" : "<value to match>" } replace_document = { "<new document field name>" : "<new document value>" } result = await collection.replace_one(query_filter, replace_document) print (result.modified_count)

sections.heading: Delete One
sections.content: To learn more about the delete_one() method, see the Delete Documents guide.
code_blocks: query_filter = { "<field to match>" : "<value to match>" } result = collection.delete_one(query_filter) print (result.deleted_count)
query_filter = { "<field to match>" : "<value to match>" } result = await collection.delete_one(query_filter) print (result.deleted_count)

sections.heading: Delete Multiple
sections.content: To learn more about the delete_many() method, see the Delete Documents guide.
code_blocks: query_filter = { "<field to match>" : "<value to match>" } result = collection.delete_many(query_filter) print (result.deleted_count)
query_filter = { "<field to match>" : "<value to match>" } result = await collection.delete_many(query_filter) print (result.deleted_count)

sections.heading: Bulk Write
sections.content: To learn more about the bulk_write() method, see the Bulk Write guide.
code_blocks: operations = [ pymongo.InsertOne( { "<field name>" : "<value>" } ), pymongo.UpdateMany( { "<field to match>" : "<value to match>" }, { "$set" : { "<field name>" : "<value>" }}, ), pymongo.DeleteOne( { "<field to match>" : "<value to match>" } ), ] result = collection.bulk_write(operations) print (result)

operations = [ pymongo.InsertOne( { "<field name>" : "<value>" } ), pymongo.UpdateMany( { "<field to match>" : "<value to match>" }, { "$set" : { "<field name>" : "<value>" }}, ), pymongo.DeleteOne( { "<field to match>" : "<value to match>" } ), ] result = await collection.bulk_write(operations) print (result)

sections.heading: Find One
sections.content:
To learn more about the find_one() method, see Find One Document in
the Retrieve Data guide.
code_blocks: results = collection.find_one({ "<field name>" : "<value>" }) print (results)
results = await collection.find_one({ "<field name>" : "<value>" }) print (results)

sections.heading: Find Multiple
sections.content:
To learn more about the find() method, see Find Multiple Documents in
the Retrieve Data guide.
code_blocks: results = collection.find({ "<field name>" : "<value>" }) for document in results: print (document)
results = collection.find({ "<field name>" : "<value>" }) async for document in results: print (document)

sections.heading: Count Documents in a Collection
sections.content: To learn more about the count_documents() method, see the Retrieve an Accurate Count guide.
code_blocks: count = collection.count_documents({}) print (count)
count = await collection.count_documents({}) print (count)

sections.heading: Count Documents Returned from a Query
sections.content: To learn more about the count_documents() method, see the Retrieve an Accurate Count guide.
code_blocks: count = collection.count_documents({ "<field name>" : "<value>" }) print (count)
count = await collection.count_documents({ "<field name>" : "<value>" }) print (count)

sections.heading: Estimated Document Count
sections.content: To learn more about the estimated_document_count() method, see the Retrieve an Estimated Count guide.
code_blocks: count = collection.estimated_document_count() print (count)
count = await collection.estimated_document_count() print (count)

sections.heading: Retrieve Distinct Values
sections.content:
To learn more about the distinct() method, see the Retrieve Distinct Field Values guide.

code_blocks: results = collection.distinct( "<field name>" ) for document in results: print (document)
